pageContext.claim: “For a long time, there were questions as to whether or not Saudi Arabia -- and other countries -- were sponsoring terror. And I know, when speaking to not only you but your father, the King, a tremendous effort has been put on to go the exact opposite way.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has embraced Saudi Arabia during his presidency, but there are still questions about its funding of and ties to extremist groups. Congress, for example, passed legislation in 2016 allowing U.S. family members of 9/11 victims to sue Saudi Arabia for potential damages. The bill was passed by overriding President Barack Obama's veto.
